Bay Area Sunset Hike and Hops
Join REI and our local park partners for a gorgeous hike at one of the best places to view the sunset in the San Francisco Bay Area.
Russian Ridge OSP, Palo Alto: Russian Ridge Main Lot
06/01/18, 05:30 PM
Member: $39
Non Member: $59
Introduction to Bouldering - Rock Climbing Class - Level 1
Set the ropes aside and launch into the exciting world of bouldering! Join our professional climbing instructors for a day introducing you to outdoor bouldering, spotting falls, and advanced body movement to get you to the top of your climbs.
Sanborn County Park, Saratoga: Skyline Blvd. Indian Rock Trailhead Parking
06/03/18, 08:30 AM
Member: $59
Non Member: $79
Wilderness Survival: 3-Season Skills
Join REI Outdoor School for a wilderness survival class. We will provide practical tips and strategies that every outdoor traveler should know: emergency priorities; shelters; locating and accessing drinking water; and how to make your own emergency kit. You will also participate in interactive scenarios to practice and hone your skills.
Sanborn County Park, Saratoga: Main Parking Lot
06/03/18, 09:00 AM
Women's Only Class: Sanborn County Park, Saratoga: Main Parking Lot
06/24/18, 09:00 AM
Member: $69
Non Member: $89
Women's Bike Maintenance Basics
Join us for a women's introductory bike maintenance class designed to teach you routine maintenance to keep you riding smooth and prolong the life of your bike.
Mountain View REI
06/05/18, 07:00 PM
FREE
Backpacking the Sierra to Mt. Whitney
Come learn about the inspiring trans-Sierra adventure, a week-long 75-mile journey across remote sections of Sequoia and Kings Canyon National Parks to the summit of Mt. Whitney (14,505 feet).
Mountain View REI
06/07/18, 07:00 PM
FREE
Rock Climbing Anchors Class - Natural & Fixed Protection - Level 1
We will cover climbing gear, knots, evaluation and use of natural and fixed protection, and equalizing the forces on the anchor. This is a hands on program where you will build climbing anchors. This outing will focus on construction and assessment of anchors.
Castle Rock State Park, Saratoga: Main Parking Lot
06/09/18, 08:00 AM
Member: $89
Non Member: $109
Sierra Overnight Backpacking
Take your first Sierra backpack trip with the experts! Learn about what to bring, how to carry it, what and how to cook, how to manage water, navigation, camp skills, and much more. Trails and distance will be moderate with elevation gain and uneven terrain.
Folsom REI
06/09/18, 08:00 AM
Member: $280
Non Member: $300
Angel Island Hike to Mount Livermore
The view from Mt. Livermore is hands-down one of the best in the Bay Area! Join REI on a beautiful ferry ride to Angel Island State Park for a day hiking around this historic island.
Angel Island State Park: Tiburon Ferry
06/09/18, 08:30 AM
Member: $49
Non Member: $69
Angel Island Campout
Camp under the stars with REI on scenic Angel Island! Enjoy live music, gourmet camp dinner and s'mores with incredible views of the San Francisco skyline.
Angel Island State Park: Tiburon Ferry
06/09/18, 10:00 AM
Member: $149
Non Member: $169
Learn to Kayak Class
This class will introduce students to the basics of paddling a kayak in a mild setting and at a relaxed pace. Students will learn about kayaks, paddles, gear and clothing before learning to launch and being introduced to the basic paddle strokes. This class is a great way for those considering kayaking to try it out.
Redwood City: Public Boat Launch
06/10/18, 09:00 AM
Foster City Lagoon: Dog Park Parking Lot
06/16/18, 09:00 AM
Member: $79
Non Member: $99
Backcountry Navigation With A Map & Compass - Level 1
Are you heading into the woods and want to learn how to use your map & compass properly? This class will teach you how to translate what is on your map to the surrounding area. How to use your compass easily and effectively to find your location, putting the Map & Compass together to plan your route and adjust as needed.
Monte Bello Open Space, Palo Alto: Main Parking Lot
06/10/18, 09:00 AM
Member: $69
Non Member: $89
Bike Maintenance Basics - Level 2: Brakes & Drive Train
If you've already taken a Bike Maintenance Basics class, this is your next step! Get prepared for the road or trail ahead by digging a little deeper into the components of your ride and learn what minor adjustments you can make.
Mountain View REI
06/12/18, 07:00 PM
FREE
Lightweight Backpacking Basics
Do you want to try backpacking but worry about carrying a heavy pack? Join an REI backpacking expert who will provide excellent tips on lightweight backpacking techniques.
Mountain View REI
06/14/18, 07:00 PM
FREE
Evening Kayak Tour - San Francisco Bay
Break out of your usual evening routine and join our instructors for a night-time tour on the Bay! We will provide all the gear and basic paddle instruction, using easy-to-paddle tandem (two-person) kayaks, then head out for a short paddle by starlight. No experience is required, but taking a Learn to Kayak Class is recommended.
Redwood City: Public Boat Launch
06/15/18, 07:00 PM
Member: $69
Non Member: $89
Introduction to Outdoor Rock Climbing Class - Level 1
Learn basic Climbing skills and technique including specialized equipment use, proper fit of specialized equipment, site safety, knot tying, belay technique, basic climbing technique. This course is designed for new climbers or gym trained climbers looking to transition to the outdoor experience.
Sanborn County Park, Saratoga: Skyline Blvd. Indian Rock Trailhead Parking
06/16/18, 08:00 AM
Member: $89
Non Member: $109
Learn to Stand Up Paddleboard (SUP) Class
Learn what you need to know to get started in the exciting sport of Stand Up Paddleboarding. We'll teach you proper stance, paddling strokes, and balance on the board. You'll get on the water instruction and practice. All equipment included.
Foster City Lagoon: Dog Park Parking Lot
06/16/18, 09:00 AM
Member: $69
Non Member: $89
Bike N Brews Tour: Santa Cruz Coast
Bikes and Beer! What better way to spend a day? Explore some of the world's most beautiful coastline on a mountain bike. The ride is beginner friendly at 15 miles and 150 feet of elevation gain. After the ride we will head over to the Santa Cruz Mountain Brewery.
Santa Cruz Mountain Brewery: Dirt Parking Lot
06/17/18, 09:00 AM
Member: $79
Non Member: $99
Prepare for the Unexpected: Urban Emergency Preparedness
What happens when flood, fire, pandemic, tornadoes, or other disasters affect your community? Where will you go? What will you do? Learn valuable planning and survival techniques that may one day help save your life or the lives of those you love.
Mountain View REI
06/19/18, 07:00 PM
FREE
Gourmet Camp Cooking
If your camp meals have been following the same old pattern, join us for some insight into putting the gourmet back in your camping experience. We'll break down some of the components of great meals and translate how to bring them into the outdoors. Bring your appetite for adventure!
Mountain View REI
06/21/18, 07:00 PM
FREE
Outdoor Rock Climbing 2.0
Join our professional instructors in this small group climbing class to get more time on the rock, refine your skills and continue your growth as a rock climber.
Castle Rock State Park, Saratoga: Main Parking Lot
06/23/18, 08:00 AM
Member: $119
Non Member: $139
Introduction to Mountain Biking Class - Level 1
On easy terrain, our instructors teach basic mountain biking techniques including shifting, braking, ascending, descending and maneuvering around obstacles. Mountain bikes are available for use in the class. Recommended for ages 14 and older. Those under 18 must be accompanied by a parent or responsible adult.
Women's Only Class: Skyline Ridge Open Space Preserve, Palo Alto: Equestrian Lot
06/23/18, 09:00 AM
Skyline Ridge Open Space Preserve, Palo Alto: Equestrian Lot
06/24/18, 09:00 AM
Member: $79
Non Member: $99
Introduction to Coastal Kayaking Class - Level 1
This course is designed for those who want to kayak in a coastal environment. Students will learn about proper kayak and gear selection, how to read a tide log, and the fundamental paddle strokes to control your kayak.
Redwood City: Public Boat Launch
06/23/18, 09:00 AM
Member: $119
Non Member: $139
Wilderness First Aid with NOLS and REI
Whether spending time in the backcountry is your passion or your profession, you should never have to ask, What do I do now? In just two days, you will learn the knowledge, skills and ability to make sound decisions in emergency situations. This course is ideal for trip leaders, camp staff, outdoor enthusiasts and individuals in remote locations.
Spring Lake Regional Park, Santa Rosa: Oak Knoll Picnic Area
06/30/18, 08:00 AM
Coyote Point Park, San Mateo: Captain's House Parking Lot
07/14/18, 08:00 AM
Member: $235
Non Member: $265
Overnight Backpacking Class
Take your first backpack trip with the experts! Learn about what to bring, how to carry it, what and how to cook, how to manage water, navigation and camp skills, and much more in an intensive 2 day course. The load will be light and the trail easy, designed with beginners in mind.
Point Reyes National Seashore: Bear Valley Visitor Center
07/09/18, 10:00 AM
Women's Only Class: Portola Redwoods State Park
07/14/18, 09:00 AM
